articles.title: Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Work in Field of Light Industry
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Work in Field of Light Industry
						
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, provided field guidance to the work in the field of light industry, going round the second commodity exhibition of Pyongyang Department Store No. 1.
					 Making the rounds of garments, shoes, foodstuffs, domestic utensils, kitchen utensils, school things, goods for cultural use and daily use and other varieties of goods displayed in the exhibition, he acquainted himself in detail with varieties, quality and production of goods.
					
					  Seeing goods one by one for hours, he was greatly satisfied with the fact that officials and other working people of industrial establishments and various other production units contributed to the exhibition quality goods of diverse varieties including consumer goods produced in the spirit of devoted service to the people.
					
					 New innovative successes are being made in the field of light industry day by day, he noted, adding that this stirring reality is a clear proof of the validity and vitality of the Workers' Party of Korea's policy calling for devoting everything to improving the standard of people's living.
					
					 After going round the exhibition, he set forth on the spot the important tasks to serve as guidelines for further developing the light industry.
					
					 In order to further develop the light industry, it is necessary to further improve the production structure of the light industry as required by the developing reality and the daily growing need of the people and wage a more powerful drive to modernize the light industry, he said. It is also necessary to further develop the local industry and, at the same time, steadily step up the production of consumer goods in a massive movement.
					
					 As the validity and vitality of the Workers' Party of Korea's policy for improving the standard of people's living are being displayed through commercial service networks, the light industrial factories and other relevant units should produce and send goods to Pyongyang Department Store No. 1 and other department stores and shops on a regular basis with no goods out of stock, he said. Only when shop networks are stacked with quality goods of diverse varieties, our officials can claim they have successfully discharged their mission and duty as the servants of the people, he added.
					
					 He underlined the need to further improve the commercial service to meet the intrinsic demand of socialist commerce.
					
					 It is the firm determination and will of the Workers' Party of Korea to bring about an epochal turn in improving the standard of people's living and building a thriving country in 2012, the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, he said, earnestly calling upon all the Party members and other working people to dynamically effect a great surge to proudly enter the grand April festival with labor gifts of loyalty to the country and the people.
					
					 He was accompanied by Mun Kyong Dok, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Thae Jong Su and Choe Ryong Hae, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, and Pak Pong Ju, first vice department director of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Central Zoo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Central Zoo
						
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, provided field guidance to the Central Zoo.
					 Going round the lemur and chimpanzee sheds, animal and fur seal playing grounds and other places of the zoo, he acquainted himself in detail with its management and operation.
					
					 He highly praised the officials and employees of the zoo for arranging the animal sheds to suite the ecological characteristics of wild animals and actively contributing to providing working people and school youth and students with cultural and emotional life.
					
					 He was greatly satisfied to hear a report that people are spending pleasant rest while seeing varieties of skills of animals. 
					
					 He underlined the need to spruce up the zoo well as befitting an education center to help visitors widen knowledge about animals and nurture the spirit of socialist patriotism, not mere a sightseeing place, and thus actively contribute to the rest and education of visitors including school youth and students.
					
					 He stressed the need to do in a bold way the work to build up the zoo into a huge natural one as instructed by President Kim Il Sung in his lifetime so that visitors might see animals inhabiting in nature.
					
					 In order to let more working people, school youth and children visit the zoo to enjoy a cultural and emotional life in the future, it is necessary to further perfect the interior and exterior of the animal sheds to the convenience of the visitors and, at the same time, set up sufficient facilities for resting, he noted.
					
					 What is important for managing the zoo is to protect the natural environment, he said, underlining the need to preserve even a single tree and a blade of grass to their original state and take thorough measures to prevent the pollution of mountains and streams.
					
					 He was accompanied by senior officials of party and armed forces organs Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Thae Jong Su, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, Ju Kyu Chang, U Tong Chuk, Kim Chang Sop and Ri Myong Su, Members of the Central Military Commission of the WPK Kim Kyong Ok, Kim Won Hong, Kim Yong Chol and Yun Jong Rin and Department Director of the NDC Hyon Chol Hae.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Message of Greetings to Party and State Leaders of China
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Message of Greetings to Party and State Leaders of China
						
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, together with President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly Kim Yong Nam and Premier Choe Yong Rim, Sunday sent a message of greetings to General Secretary of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and President of China Hu Jintao, Chairman of the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress Wu Bangguo and Premier of the State Council Wen Jiabao.
					 The message said:
					
					 We extend warm congratulations to you and, through you, to the CPC Central Committee and the government and the people of China in the name of the WPK and the government and the people of the DPRK on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the DPRK-China treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance.
					
					 The conclusion of the treaty marked an epoch-making event which provided a legal foundation for boosting on a permanent basis the DPRK-China friendly and cooperative relations sealed on the road of bloody struggle for independence against imperialism and for socialism.
					
					 Since the conclusion of the treaty, the two parties and governments have supported each other and closely cooperated with each other in various fields including politics, military, economy and culture and powerfully demonstrated before the whole world the invincible vitality of the everlasting DPRK-China friendship no matter how much water flowed under the bridge and how frequently a generation is replaced by another.
					
					 The traditional relations of the DPRK-China friendship, which stood all tests of history and made steady advance, have been successfully carried forward and developed on a new strategic height and made a great contribution to encouraging the two peoples in the common cause of socialism and ensuring peace and stability in Northeast Asia and other parts of the world.
					
					 It is the steadfast stand of the party and the government of the DPRK to steadily consolidate the DPRK-China friendly and cooperative relations, the precious legacy and common treasure handed down by the leaders of the elder generations of the two countries generation after generation.
					
					 We are convinced that the bonds of militant solidarity, friendship and cooperation between the two parties, the two countries and the two peoples will grow stronger in all fields at a higher stage thanks to their concerted efforts this significant year, the 50th anniversary of the DPRK-China treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance.
					
					 We, availing ourselves of this opportunity, wish the fraternal Chinese people greater successes in building a harmonious socialist society based on the scientific outlook on development under the leadership of the CPC with a glorious nine decade-long history and the People's Republic of China, a friendly neighbor, prosperity and your people happiness.

articles.title: Message to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Leaders
articles.content:
Message to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Leaders
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, together with Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People’s Assembly, and Choe Yong Rim, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Sunday received a message sent by Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, president of the People's Republic of China and chairman of the Central Military Commission, together with Wu Bangguo, chairman of the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People’s Congress, and Wen Jiabao, premier of the Chinese State Council. 
					 The message said:
					
					 We send warm congratulations and best wishes to you, and, through you, to the WPK, the government and people of the DPRK on behalf of the CPC, and the government and people of China, on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the conclusion of the Sino-DPRK treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance. 
					
					 The treaty is an important document in the Sino-DPRK relations.
					
					 Over the past five decades, both sides have supported each other and closely cooperated with each other on the principle and spirit of the treaty, promoting the cause of socialist construction in the two countries and defending peace and stability in the area.
					
					 The Sino-DPRK friendship is the one which was provided by the leaders of the elder generation of the two countries and cultivated with sincerity by them and which stood the tests of history and is deeply rooted in the minds of the two peoples. 
					
					 It is the firm strategic policy of the Chinese party and government to steadily consolidate and develop the Sino-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations. 
					
					 We together with the DPRK side will inherit the tradition and carve out it in a forward-looking manner, advance with the era and steadily deepen the bilateral friendly exchange and cooperation in different fields and thus ceaselessly develop the Sino-DPRK relations.
					
					 We are pleased to see a lot of successes made by the Korean people in various fields for building a thriving country under the leadership of the WPK headed by Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 We wholeheartedly wish the DPRK prosperity and its people happiness.

articles.title: Greetings to Prime Minister of Bahamas
articles.content:
Greetings to Prime Minister of Bahamas
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Premier Choe Yong Rim Sunday sent a message of greetings to Prime Minister of Bahamas Hubert Alexander Ingraham on the occasion of the 38th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message wished the friendly government and the people of Bahamas progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Participants in Meeting of Activists of Chongryon
articles.content:
Greetings to Participants in Meeting of Activists of Chongryon
						
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly Sunday sent a message of greetings to the participants in the meeting of activists of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) to open a new heyday in the movement of Koreans in Japan.
					 The message said:
					
					 Even under the difficult situation where the reactionaries at home and abroad are getting evermore frantic in their moves to suppress Chongryon and its organizations and the Koreans in Japan suffered great losses owing to the unexpected natural disasters, Chongryon has waged a vigorous struggle to usher in a new heyday in the movement of Koreans in Japan confident and optimistic about a sure victory, making great progress in its overall patriotic work.
					
					 The Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly is pleased that the participants in the meeting of activists have performed innovations and feats in their struggle to usher in a new heyday in the movement of Koreans in Japan, keeping pace with the dynamic advance of the people in the homeland, and highly appreciates them.
					
					 For Chongryon to lay a solid springboard for opening up a new heyday in the movement of Koreans in Japan in 2012, the year in which the homeland is opening the gate to a thriving country is an honorable and fruitful patriotic work for carrying out the noble last instructions of President Kim Il Sung to build single-mindedly united, prosperous and promising Chongryon and Korean community.
					
					 Chongryon should make itself take on the appearance of a new heyday in the movement of Koreans in Japan in all aspects and thus build its proud organizations and Korean community where the happiness of compatriots and bright future will be brought into full bloom.
					
					 The officials of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan should make a tangible contribution to the building of a thriving country and conduct a patriotic work to accelerate the independent reunification of the country and conduct positive foreign activities to boost amity and friendship with the Japanese people, the message stressed.

articles.title: Chinese Ambassador Gives Reception
articles.content:
Chinese Ambassador Gives Reception
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai gave a reception at Yanggakdo International Hotel on Sunday on the 50th anniversary of the DPRK-China treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance.
					 Present there on invitation were Premier Choe Yong Rim, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Chun, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and minister of the People's Armed Forces, Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-premier, Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials of party and armed forces organs, ministries and national institutions. 
					
					 Present there were a friendship delegation of China led by Zhang Dejiang, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council, a delegation of the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries and the China-Korea Friendship Association headed by Wu Donghe, chairman of the China-Korea Friendship Association, staff members of the Chinese embassy here and Chinese guests staying in the DPRK.
					
					 Liu Hongcai said that General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited China several times, meeting with leading officials of the Chinese party and state including General Secretary Hu Jintao and reaching common understanding.
					
					 Both sides are significantly marking the golden jubilee of the treaty by jointly holding splendid events, he said. This is demonstrating at home and abroad the solidity and invincibility of the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship and promoting a new development of the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations, he added.
					
					 He wholeheartedly wished the Korean people greater success in socialist construction under the leadership of the WPK headed by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Chinese side will join the DPRK side to inherit the tradition and hew out the future and thus strive to bring about richer fruition of the Sino-DPRK friendly relations, he stressed.
					
					 Kim Yong Chun recalled in his speech that President Kim Il Sung signed the DPRK-China treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance together with Primer Zhou Enlai, providing a solid legal foundation for steadily boosting the DPRK-China friendship on the road of accomplishing the anti-imperialist and socialist cause.
					
					 It is the unanimous will and determination of the two parties and governments to steadily consolidate the DPRK-China friendship, the precious legacy and common treasure handed down by the revolutionaries of the elder generations of the two countries.
					
					 He wished the fraternal Chinese people greater successes in successfully carrying out the tasks of the first year of the 12th Five-Year Plan under the leadership of the Communist Party of China with Hu Jintao as its general secretary and building a comprehensively well-off society.

articles.title: Chinese Delegation Here
articles.content:
Chinese Delegation Here
						
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries and the China-Korea Friendship Association arrived here Sunday to attend the celebrations of the 50th anniversary of the DPRK-China treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance. It is headed by Wu Donghe, chairman of the China-Korea Friendship Association.

articles.title: Chinese Friendship Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Chinese Friendship Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- A friendship delegation of China led by Zhang Dejiang, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council, visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace and paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung on Sunday.
					A floral basket in the name of the delegation was laid before the statue of the President.
					
					 The guests paid homage to the President who made an immortal contribution to the development of the DPRK-China friendship and the accomplishment of the cause of global independence.
					
					 Zhang made an entry in the visitor's book.
					
					 The delegation arrived here on the day at the invitation of the DPRK government.

articles.title: Wreath Laid before Friendship Tower
articles.content:
Wreath Laid before Friendship Tower
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- A friendship delegation of China led by Zhang Dejiang, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council, laid a wreath before the Friendship Tower on Sunday.
					 Present there were Vice Foreign Minister Kim Hyong Jun, officials concerned and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 A wreath in the name of Zhang Dejiang was laid before the Friendship Tower.
					
					 They paid silent tribute to the fallen fighters of the Chinese People's Volunteers who bravely fought on the Korean front.

articles.title: Opera "Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai" Staged for Chinese Guests of Honor
articles.content:
Opera "Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai" Staged for Chinese Guests of Honor 
						
Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Opera "Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai" was staged at the Pyongyang Grand Theatre Sunday for the friendship delegation of China led by Zhang Dejiang, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council. 
					The opera adapted from a Chinese folk legend deals with the tragic love between a daughter of an aristocrat's family and a son of a literary man's family. It roundly exposes and criticizes the unfair feudal status system and marriage system.
					
					Among the audience were Vice-premier Kang Nung Su, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Hyong Jun, Vice-Minister of Culture Han Chol, officials concerned, working people in the city and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					The opera was acclaimed by the audience for fully meeting the requirements of the original work and ensuring high artistry.

articles.title: Voters' Lists Displayed at Constituencies, Sub-constituencies of DPRK
articles.content:
Voters' Lists Displayed at Constituencies, Sub-constituencies of DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Voters lists were displayed Saturday at the constituencies and sub-constituencies for the election of deputies to the provincial (municipal), city (district) and county people's assemblies of the DPRK.
					 The lists were worked out strictly according to the law on election of deputies to people's assemblies at all levels of the DPRK.
					
					 Registered there are all citizens with suffrage residing in the relevant areas.
					
					 The voters are confirming the accuracy of their names registered.

articles.title: Large Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy from Cambodian King and Great King
articles.content:
Large Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy from Cambodian King and Great King
						
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Cambodian King Norodom Sihamoni and Great King Norodom Sihanouk sent large floral baskets to the DPRK embassy on the occasion of the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Upon the authorization of the king and the great king, a delegation of the Ministry of Royal Palace of the Cambodian government headed by Kong Sam Ol, deputy prime minister for the Royal Palace, on July 6 visited the DPRK embassy and laid the large floral baskets before a portrait of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Hyong Jik
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Hyong Jik
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the statue of Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter and an outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea, in Ponghwa-ri, Kangdong County of Pyongyang, and his grave in Mangyongdae on Sunday on the occasion of the 117th anniversary of his birth.
					 Seen there were wreaths from Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremonies were senior officials of the Party, state and army, officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, servicepersons, working people and youth and students.
					
					 Placed before the statue and grave were wreaths in the name of the WPK Central Committee, the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly and the DPRK Cabinet. Those from ministries and national institutions, scientific and educational institutions, military academies and party and power organs, enterprises and farms  in Pyongyang were also placed there.
					
					The participants paid silent tribute to Kim Hyong Jik, looking back on the brilliant revolutionary life and exploits performed by him.
					
					 On the same day wreaths and flowers were laid before his statues at Kim Hyong Jik Military Medical University and in Sakju County, North Phyongan Province and Junggang County, Jagang Province.

articles.title: Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (7)
articles.content:
Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (7)
Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- A female worker of the Ryangchaek Bearing Factory is leading a worthwhile life in the flower garden of the single-minded unity achieved by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 He went to the factory in January, Juche 89 (2000) in the course of the forced march for on-spot guidance.
					
					 Visiting an assembling shop, he saw Jo Jong Suk, the then assembling worker, assembling bearings. He praised her skill and efforts.
					
					 He is the real father of the Korean women as he supported her resolution to devote her whole life to the significant factory visited by him and looked after even the life of her family with meticulous care.
					
					 Greatly inspired by his loving care, she brought about uninterrupted innovations in production, overfulfilling her plan every year. She is working as a head of the assembling shop while training high skilled workers.
					
					 Once an ordinary female assembling worker, she has worked hard to repay the leader's profound trust and benevolence. She is a deputy to the provincial people's assembly and often has the honor of national meetings as a delegate.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Hideous Provocations against DPRK under Fire
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Hideous Provocations against DPRK under Fire
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The hideous provocations hurting the system and dignity of the DPRK perpetrated by the south Korean bellicose forces are a clear declaration of war against it and the most serious acts of bedeviling the inter-Korean relations and disturbing peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday says this in a by-lined commentary.
					
					 Such hideous provocations have been prepared and systematically pushed forward by traitor Lee Myung Bak and military bosses who are steeped in extremely hostility toward the DPRK to the marrow of their bones, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 What merits more serious attention is that the ceaseless anti-DPRK provocations have been staged, pursuant to the "state policy" of the group of traitors and as a main link in the chain of the puppet military's war rackets against the DPRK.
					
					 It is the army and people of the DPRK who regard the dignity of its leadership as the lifeline of the nation and lay down even their lives to defend it even if the sky were to fall and the earth to break.
					
					 They will take merciless and strong retaliatory military measures against the south Korean puppet authorities, leaving no means untried, till they put an end to all their hideous crimes and make an apology to the nation for them.

articles.title: Tragic Cases Occur in S. Korean Puppet Army
articles.content:
Tragic Cases Occur in S. Korean Puppet Army
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- A south Korean puppet army soldier shot his several colleagues to death at a Kanghwado coastal post of the Second Division of the Marine Corps on July 4, the south Korean KBS reported. It was confirmed that this tragedy was caused due to the harsh treatment by his superiors of the unit, it added.
					 It is daily occurrences at this unit that superiors beat soldiers at random, seared their arms with burning cigarettes and put insecticides into trousers to irk them. And soldiers' freedom of religion is also suppressed.
					
					 On July 3 a soldier of the unit, availing himself of an opportunity of outing, committed suicide by tying his neck at the balustrade of a building in Juksan-myon, Ansong City, Kyonggi Province, unable to bear the brutal behavior of his superiors.
					
					 The number of the soldiers who had been carried to hospitals due to diseases caused by the superiors' beating at the First and Second Divisions of the puppet Marine Corps reached more than 900 in the past two years, the report said.

articles.title: S. Korean Unionists Launch Strike
articles.content:
S. Korean Unionists Launch Strike
						
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The Samhwa Expressway Trade Union of the Bus Action Headquarters affiliated with the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions entered into an all-out strike on July 8 in protest against the business side's refusal to pay wages in arrears, the south Korean MBC reported.
					 The trade union denounced the business side for neither recognizing it as a negotiating organization nor properly paying wages in arrears to unionists.

articles.title: Wholesale Suppression of Pro-reunification Forces in S. Korea
articles.content:
Wholesale Suppression of Pro-reunification Forces in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet Intelligence Service and fascist police suppressed more than ten citizens and labor activists who participated in the reunification movement by invoking the ill-famed "National Security Law".
					 The fascists searched their houses from July 4 to 6 on charges that they received instructions from the north while working at the reunification movement organizations including the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification and they are suspected of organizing an underground party and conducting espionage, etc. 
					
					 Meanwhile, investigators of the Intelligence Service and the Police Agency on July 6 were busy searching the houses of An Jae Gu, former professor at Kyongbuk National University, and his son who are pro-reunification activists.
					
					 The fascist authorities took such action against them on the strength of the NSL, on charges that they had exchange with the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan as representative of magazine Minjok 21.

articles.title: S. Korean Minister of Unification Urged to Step Down
articles.content:
S. Korean Minister of Unification Urged to Step Down
						
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- A civic organization related to the north-south economic cooperation in south Korea demanded Hyon In Thaek, minister of Unification, step down for standing in the way of inter-Korean cooperation and exchange on July 7.
					 The organization said that south Korean businesses are on the verge of bankruptcy due to the unreasonable "May 24 measure" taken by the authorities.
					
					 However, the ministry is disallowing even inter-Korean contact for tiding over crisis, far from compensating for the damages, it deplored, stressing:
					
					It would come out for the movement to force Hyon to step down.

articles.title: Internet Special Homepage Opens
articles.content:
Internet Special Homepage Opens 
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain opened an internet special homepage on the occasion of the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The homepage titled "In recollection of Comrade Kim Il Sung" consists of a main page and other pages.
					
					 The main page carried the beaming image of the President and his photos among soldiers of the people's army and the children and edited the words of the immortal revolutionary paean "Song of General Kim Il Sung".
					
					 Posted on other pages are books, photos and films. Seen on them are the "Short Biography of Comrade Kim Il Sung" and his reminiscences "With the Century" and more than 70 photos showing the revolutionary history and exploits of the peerlessly great man, a video showing the Korean people in deep grief over the sudden death of the President, etc.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Internet of British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Internet of British Organization
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on July 5 posted on its Internet homepage the full text of President Kim Il Sung's work "The Path of the Korean Revolution".
					 The work, published on June 30, Juche 19 (1930), specifies the basic stand and attitude to be maintained by the communists in the revolutionary struggle, the nature and duties of the Korean revolution and the Juche-based line and policies for successfully carrying out the Korean revolution.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Bangladeshi Personage
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Bangladeshi Personage
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- M. Jahangir Khan, chairman of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy, issued a statement on July 4 on the occasion of the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The President was an outstanding political activist who had led to victory the anti-imperialist struggle and socialist construction under the uplifted banner of the Juche idea and the Songun idea all his life since he embarked upon the road of revolution in his early years, the statement said.
					
					 The undying feats he performed for the Korean revolution and the world revolution will shine long, it noted, and went on:
					
					 The Korean people are now dynamically advancing to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche started by him under the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 We are firmly convinced that the Korean people would register greater successes in the drive to reunify the country and build a thriving socialist nation under his wise leadership.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Remembered in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Seminars on the exploits of President Kim Il Sung, reading sessions on his reminiscences "With the Century", lectures, photo exhibitions and film shows were held by a regional organization and in Ethiopia, Democratic Congo, Britain, Romania, Nigeria, Thailand and Guinea on the occasion of the 17th anniversary of his demise from July 1 to 9. 
					 The executive advisor to the general secretary of the Pan-African Movement stressed that it was Kim Il Sung who founded socialist Korea which is now displaying the might of the politico-ideological power, military power and scientific and technological power in the international community.
					
					 The secretary general of the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea referred to the fact that the President founded the immortal Juche idea, clearly indicating the road to be followed by the human cause of independence and that he sincerely helped the African countries in their efforts to achieve independence and build a new society.
					
					 The chairperson of the Group for the Study of Juche Idea of Kim Jong Il of Democratic Congo noted that the DPRK enforced such popular policies as the high-level universal free medical care and free education systems to be envied even by those countries which claim they are advanced under the leadership of the President.
					
					 A member of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist) expressed conviction that the cause of the Korean people to build a great prosperous and powerful nation and reunify the country is sure to win as they are led by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered by Ethiopian and Czech Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Remembered by Ethiopian and Czech Organizations
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Bulletins were issued by Ethiopian and Czech organizations on the occasion of the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea carried an article titled "Political Idea of President Kim Il Sung" in its bulletin on July 1.
					
					 The life of Kim Il Sung, the founder of socialist Korea, was totally dedicated to the people, the bulletin said, and went on:
					
					 He regarded believing in people as in Heaven as his motto, put forward the Korean people as the masters of the country and the society and always regarded them as the best teachers.
					
					The journeys made by him for field guidance till the last moments of his life from the day of liberation reached 578,000 kilometers equal to the length enough to go round the earth 14 and half times.
					
					The Czech Group for the Study and Materialization of the Juche Idea and the Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association edited articles in their joint bulletin on July 4 praising Kim Il Sung who made a great contribution to the Korean revolution and the cause of global independence and the exploits of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, the most creditable successor to the cause of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Meeting of East Asian Red Cross Opens
articles.content:
Meeting of East Asian Red Cross Opens
 Beijing, July 9 (KCNA) -- A meeting of East Asian Red Cross was opened at the inner Mongolia Autonomous Region of China on July 5.
					 Attending the meeting were delegations of the DPRK and East Asian regional red crosses. It will reportedly discuss disaster relief operations, treatment and prevention of AIDS, voluntary service of Red Cross, etc.

articles.title: China Denounces Japan's Espionage
articles.content:
China Denounces Japan's Espionage 
 Beijing, July 9 (KCNA) -- An official of the Press Secretariat of the Chinese Defense Ministry at a press conference on July 7 denounced Japan's espionage.
					 He accused aircraft of the Japan Air "Self-Defense Force" of steadily expanding the scope of espionage against China in its East Sea and Japan's warships and planes of monitoring and watching the normal activities of the Chinese side.
					
					 This may arouse misunderstanding and misjudgment of both sides, he said, urging Japan to stop such dangerous actions so that accidents might not occur in the seas and sky.

articles.title: China Plans to Increase Investment in Education
articles.content:
China Plans to Increase Investment in Education 
 Beijing, July 9 (KCNA) -- The State Council of China recently published its opinion calling on different areas and fields to further increase investment in education. 
					 The opinion urged various areas and fields to attain in time the goal to bring the state expenditure for education to 4 percent of GNP till 2012 through effective measures.

articles.title: Senior Official Calls for Closer International Cooperation in Combating Corruption
articles.content:
Senior Official Calls for Closer International Cooperation in Combating Corruption
 Beijing, July 9 (KCNA) -- A senior Chinese official has called on international community to conduct closer cooperation in combating corruption.
					 Zhou Yongkang, secretary of the Political Science and Law Committee of the Central Committee of the Community Party of China, made the remarks at the third seminar of the International Association of Anti-Corruption Authorities (IAACA) that began in Shanghai on Monday.
					
					 Fighting corruption is the common wish of the whole mankind, Zhou said, adding it is common task facing governments and political parties in different countries.
					
					 He said he believed that the current seminar, with the theme of international cooperation, will further promote international cooperation in the anti-corruption field.
					
					All countries, regions and relevant international organizations should work closer together to prevent and crack down on transnational organized corruption, exert great efforts to solve problems and build a perfect mechanism, he said.

articles.title: Document on Value Concepts on Core Revolutionary Soldier Distributed in China
articles.content:
Document on Value Concepts on Core Revolutionary Soldier Distributed in China
						
 Beijing, July 9 (KCNA) -- The General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army has recently published "Opinion on steadily cultivating the value concepts on core revolutionary soldiers at present and promoting them" and distributed it to the whole army and armed police units.
					 The opinion calls for comprehensively and systematically dealing with the significance of the work, guiding idea, basic principle and methods, organization, etc. as required by the developing situation and new duty on the basis of experience gained by all units in recent years in the course of their study and cultivation.

articles.title: More US Military Deaths in Afghanistan
articles.content:
More US Military Deaths in Afghanistan 
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- More U.S. soldiers present in Afghanistan under the pretext of "anti-terrorist war" met deaths due to the attack operations of the resistance forces of the country.
					 At least 1 537 members of the U.S. military had died in Afghanistan since the start of the Afghan war, said the U.S. Defense Department on July 5.

articles.title: US Drone Strike in Pakistan
articles.content:
US Drone Strike in Pakistan
						
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces in Afghanistan are carrying on drone strikes against Pakistan under the pretext of "anti-terrorism".
					 At least six people were killed and five others injured in a U.S. drone strike launched late Tuesday night in Pakistan's northwest tribal area of North Waziristan.

articles.title: Cuba, Bolivia to Boost Military Ties
articles.content:
Cuba, Bolivia to Boost Military Ties
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- "Bolivia and Cuba are united by a long history, and they should have a more continuous exchange between their armed forces," Chief of Staff of the Armed Forces of Bolivia Armando Pacheco Gutierrez said upon his arrival at the Caribbean island. 
					 "We are brothers in all areas, so we must develop a sincere friendship between our armed forces," said Pacheco, who is on his second official visit to Cuba.

articles.title: PLO Condemns Israel's Unreasonable Decision
articles.content:
PLO Condemns Israel's Unreasonable Decision
						
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Ahmed Majdalani, a member of the Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO) Executive Committee, when interviewed by a news agency on July 4,  condemned Israel's unreasonable decision.
					 The Israeli government made a decision to change the names of the Arab towns in Israel into Hebrew names on Monday.
					
					 Israel "is violating the international laws and conventions," he said.
					
					 "The Israeli government has a program to change the nature and the characteristics of the Palestinian towns and villages into Jewish as part of Israelizing and forging the history," said Majdalani,
					
					 The Israeli government is the most fascist and raciest one, he noted.
